                     Breadcrumbs                                  Home                                               Research                                               Faculty Research                                               Design Technology Lab                                                          Design Technology Lab                                                                                                                 At the Design Technology Lab we work on real-world technological design problems regardless of their field: history, literature, sciences, etc. We understand how technology influences and shapes society. We educate students on technology design. We develop a generation of designers and entrepreneurs who will lead technological development.                                                              Co-Directors     Azza Abouzied , PhD, Computer Science  Assistant Professor of Computer Science     Phone : (UAE): +971 2 628 5170   Email : azza@nyu.edu   Web : http://azza.azurewebsites.net/   Jay Chen , PhD, Computer Science  Assistant Professor of Computer Science     Phone : (UAE): +971 2 628 4478   Email : jay.chen@nyu.edu   Web : http://cs.nyu.edu/~jchen/                                                                Quicklinks                                                                    Contact Us             Sitemap                                                                               Undergraduate Programs             Courses                                                                               Graduate Programs             News                                                                               Abu Dhabi Events             New York Events                                               Search         Search Query                                            Send us your feedback                           New York University Abu Dhabi                           PO Box 129188         Abu Dhabi , United Arab Emirates        Email: nyuad@nyu.edu                              Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright New York University Abu Dhabi.                                   Design Technology Lab                                                          Design Technology Lab                                                                                                                 At the Design Technology Lab we work on real-world technological design problems regardless of their field: history, literature, sciences, etc. We understand how technology influences and shapes society. We educate students on technology design. We develop a generation of designers and entrepreneurs who will lead technological development. http://t.co/uoJGj1NYh5 Stories via @MarkPlant @NYU_CREATE @MrsCCarey  01:22:57 PM December 09, 2014 from Twitter Web Client  Reply Retweet Favorite  RT @rachelbh24 : A new report by @janplass and @BarryFishman explores digital games for learning http://t.co/gLFpA0FjCL #edtech @nyusteinhar …  12:33:03 PM December 09, 2014 from Twitter Web Client  Reply Retweet Favorite  @nyu_create                                                                                  Connected Worlds Project        CREATE is the  Consortium for Research and Evaluation of Advanced Technologies in Education. CREATE members and affiliates engage in research on the design, critique, and evaluation of wide-ranging advanced digital technologies for learning. Projects housed in the consortium involve interdisciplinary teams of scholars and developers who bridge basic and applied research, development, and evaluation. CREATE fosters collaboration among scholars within NYU and partnering institutions, nationally and internationally, and it provides a range of research opportunities for doctoral, master’s and advanced undergraduate students at NYU.                                                           Projects                                        Upcoming Events  CREATE Apps     Visit DREAM to access our apps:  Ideal Gas Laws  Kinectic Molecular Theory  Phase Change  Noobs v.
